laboratory_examinations.findings: pH: 6.83 (reference range: 7.35 to 7.45), partial pressure of oxygen: 156 mm Hg, partial pressure of carbon dioxide: 43 mm Hg.
Antinuclear-antibody titer: 1:640; testing for antibodies to double-stranded DNA, Jo-1, La, Ro, Sm, Scl-70, and RNP was negative.
85% stenosis of the proximal right coronary artery and 70% stenosis in the middle segment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient had increasing symptoms which led to the exam.
Two cardiac stress tests conducted after at 55 years of age were nondiagnostic.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Thickening of aortic valve leaflets with mild insufficiency.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive thickening and calcification were noted over the years.

laboratory_examinations.date: When patient was 51 years of age
laboratory_examinations.findings: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second: 36% of predicted; vital capacity: 48%; total lung capacity: 64%; carbon monoxide diffusing capacity: 67%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A gradual decrease in lung function was noted over time.
